title: Google Expands Gemini AI with Canvas Feature and Audio Overviews
summary:
- Google has launched two new features for its Gemini AI assistant: Canvas and Audio Overviews.
- Canvas allows users to create and edit documents and code in real-time with live previews.
- Audio Overview transforms written content into a podcast-style discussion.
- These features are available globally for Gemini and Gemini Advanced subscribers.
- Competitors like Anthropic and OpenAI have similar offerings, causing competitive overlap.
- Canvas includes interactive editing and tone adjustment for writing and coding.
- Audio Overview offers audio summaries but is currently limited to English.
- Both features are free for Gemini users with some limitations on coding and audio summaries.

sources.title: Google's Gemini gets conversational coding and an AI podcast maker
Google brings a ‘canvas’ feature to Gemini, plus Audio Overview

title: CISA scrambles to contact fired employees after court rules layoffs ‘unlawful’
summary:
- The U.S. government’s cybersecurity agency, CISA, is trying to reach over 130 former employees after a court ruling deemed their layoffs 'unlawful'.
- U.S. District Judge James Bredar ordered reinstatement of employees fired by the Trump administration, particularly probationary workers hired within the last three years.
- CISA had previously cut 130 probationary employees in February, during a federal workforce reduction.
- The agency lacks contact information for all affected employees and is urging those impacted to reach out directly.
- Re-hired employees will be placed on administrative leave with full pay and benefits as per CISA's new directive.

sources.title: CISA scrambles to contact fired employees after court rules layoffs ‘unlawful’

title: HP’s Omen 16 Slim Gaming Laptop Features RTX 5070 GPU
summary:
- HP introduces the Omen 16 Slim, a 16-inch gaming laptop with a thickness of 20mm (0.79 inches).
- The laptop is designed for midrange specs, featuring an Nvidia RTX 5070 GPU.
- Expected to launch in June without finalized pricing.
- It includes a 16-inch display with a 2560 x 1600 resolution, 240Hz refresh rate, and 3ms response time.
- Powered by Intel's Arrow Lake CPUs, with configurations ranging from Core Ultra 5 225H to Core Ultra 9 285H.
- Storage starts at 512GB, and RAM at 16GB.
- Weighs 5.4 pounds, still portable but not the thinnest on the market compared to competitors like Razer's Blade 16.
- It features a variety of ports, including USB-C with Power Delivery, USB-A ports, ethernet, HDMI 2.1, and Wi-Fi 6E support.
- Other models in the Omen line expected to be refreshed alongside the 16 Slim, including Omen 17 and Victus 15.

sources.title: HP’s Omen 16 Slim Gaming Laptop Features RTX 5070 GPU

title: HP Launches 18 New OmniBook Models including Ultra-Light Aero
summary:
- HP introduces 18 new OmniBook productivity laptop models across various lines including OmniBook 3, 5, 7, and X.
- Notable model: HP OmniBook 7 Aero, weighing 2.2 pounds with AMD Ryzen AI 7 350 capabilities and options for up to 1TB SSD and 32GB RAM.
- Ports include two USB-C (10Gbps), two USB-A, HDMI 2.1, and a 3.5mm audio jack, alongside a display option of either 1920 x 1200 or 2560 x 1600 resolution.
- HP is experimenting with lattice-less keyboard designs in some models, while also refreshing 20 EliteBook models emphasizing local AI capabilities.

sources.title: HP Launches 18 New OmniBook Models including Ultra-Light Aero

title: Every gaming headset should have a backup mic like the new Cloud III S Wireless
summary:
- HyperX announces the Cloud III S Wireless gaming headset with Bluetooth 5.3 and an additional backup microphone for calls.
- Offers up to 200 hours of battery life in Bluetooth mode and 120 hours with 2.4GHz wireless.
- Features a removable boom mic and a hidden omni-directional mic for versatile use.
- Includes magnetic earcup covers allowing customization with different designs.
- Same specifications as the Cloud III, including 53mm drivers and cushy earcups for comfort.
- Launch expected in May, pricing details yet to be finalized but similar to the previous model starting at around $150.

sources.title: Every gaming headset should have a backup mic like the new Cloud III S Wireless

title: Satellite Launch Kicks Off New Effort to Monitor Wildfires from Space
summary:
- A prototype satellite was launched as part of the Google-backed initiative FireSat to detect wildfires from space.
- This is the first of at least 50 satellites planned for the FireSat constellation, developed by the Earth Fire Alliance and Muon Space.
- The project received $13 million from Google.org and support from Google Research team.
- FireSat aims to provide early detection of fires as small as 5 x 5 meters, outperforming previous satellites that needed fires to grow to two acres.
- The first launch occurred at Vandenberg Space Force Base in California on March 14th, with three additional satellites planned for 2026 and full operational capacity expected by 2030.

sources.title: Satellite Launch Kicks Off New Effort to Monitor Wildfires from Space

title: Al Gore’s Just Climate fund raises $175M from Microsoft and CalSTRS for nature-based climate investments
summary:
- Just Climate has raised $175 million from Microsoft’s Climate Innovation Fund and CalSTRS.
- The fund will focus on nature-based climate solutions like farming and forestry.
- Only $35 billion was invested in nature-based solutions in 2022, compared to $1.46 trillion for other climate finance.
- Nature-based solutions can address about 15% of annual global emissions.
- Microsoft invested in a startup called Chestnut Carbon for reforestation projects.
- Just Climate’s first investment was in NatureMetrics, which surveys biodiversity using environmental DNA (eDNA).

sources.title: Al Gore’s Just Climate fund raises $175M from Microsoft and CalSTRS for nature-based climate investments

title: Scam work centers along Thai border still have up to 100,000 people, despite multinational crackdown
summary:
- Up to 100,000 people are still working in scam centers along the Thai-Myanmar border despite recent crackdowns.
- Thailand is leading a regional initiative to dismantle these illegal facilities that generate billions annually. 
- Some individuals were trafficked by criminal gangs, while others voluntarily entered these jobs, often under false pretenses.

sources.title: Scam work centers along Thai border still have up to 100,000 people, despite multinational crackdown

title: Arcade raises $12M from Perplexity co-founder’s new fund to make AI agents less awful
summary:
- Arcade, an AI agent infrastructure startup, raised $12 million from Laude Ventures, a fund founded by Perplexity co-founder Andy Konwinski.
- Founded by Alex Salazar (former Okta exec) and Sam Partee (former Redis engineer) in February 2024, the startup aims to improve the functionality of AI agents.
- The company addresses issues with existing AI agents that often do not work effectively due to reliance on public data rather than private data.
- Arcade offers a tool-calling platform that allows AI agents to access apps and data with user-like privileges, integrating with OAuth for secure token management.

sources.title: Arcade raises $12M from Perplexity co-founder’s new fund to make AI agents less awful

title: The best hair straighteners for foolproof styling, tried and tested by our expert
summary:
- The article reviews 13 hair straighteners, ranging from budget to premium models.
- **Best overall:** GHD Platinum Plus - £199 at GHD, praised for sleek design and efficiency.
- **Best budget:** Remington Shine Therapy S8500 - £29.99 at Boots, features ceramic plates infused with natural oils.
- **Best cordless:** Dyson Corrale - £399.99 at Boots, known for flexible plates and portability.
- **Best for thick hair:** GHD Max - £174, ideal for styling long or thick hair with wide plates.
- Key testing criteria included ease of use, performance, and lasting results.

sources.title: The best hair straighteners for foolproof styling, tried and tested by our expert

title: AI-Powered Platforms Graphite and TurinTech Secure Significant Funding
summary:
- TurinTech has raised $20 million to launch its Artemis product at NVIDIA’s GTC event.
- Artemis is an ‘evolutionary AI’ platform aimed at optimizing and validating enterprise codebases, addressing inefficiencies in AI-generated code.
- The funding includes a $15 million Series A, led by Oxford Capital, with previous seed funding of $5 million.
- AI-generated code is predicted to transform software development, with Gartner projecting that 75% of enterprise software engineers will use AI code assistants by 2028.
- Graphite raised $52 million in a Series B funding round led by Accel, with participation from Anthropic’s Anthology Fund, Menlo Ventures, and others.
- Founded in 2020 by Tomas Reimers, Greg Foster, and Merrill Lutsky, Graphite initially focused on mobile development tools before pivoting to code review.
- The platform uses AI to provide feedback on code, suggest code changes, and summarize code, with plans to launch a new AI tool named Diamond for automatic bug detection.
- Graphite's revenue grew 20x in 2024, serving over 500 companies including Shopify, Snowflake, and Figma, and has made its core code review tool free for teams of all sizes.

sources.title: TurinTech reveals $20M in backing to fix problems in ‘vibe coding’
Anthropic-backed AI-powered code review platform Graphite raises cash

title: Mark Zuckerberg says that Meta’s Llama models have hit 1B downloads
summary:
- Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg announced that the Llama AI model family has reached 1 billion downloads, a 53% increase from 650 million in December 2024.
- Llama powers Meta AI across platforms like Facebook, Instagram, and WhatsApp and is available for free under a proprietary license.
- Despite its success, Llama faces challenges, including an AI copyright lawsuit and data privacy concerns leading to cancellations of launch plans in Europe.
- Meta plans to invest up to $80 billion in AI projects this year and aims to release new Llama models, including reasoning and multimodal capabilities, in the upcoming months.

sources.title: Mark Zuckerberg says that Meta’s Llama models have hit 1B downloads

title: Arizona’s Supreme Court is now using AI-generated reporters. Here’s why
summary:
- Arizona Supreme Court introduces AI-generated avatars, Victoria and Daniel, to deliver news on court rulings.
- The initiative aims to enhance public trust and understanding of judicial decisions.
- Chief Justice Ann Timmer emphasizes the need for improved communication following backlash from a controversial abortion ruling.
- Videos produced by the avatars are designed to explain court decisions more clearly and quickly.
- AI-generated reports take about 30 minutes to produce, compared to hours for traditional videos.
- The court explores various emotional delivery styles and translations to engage a wider audience.

sources.title: Arizona’s Supreme Court is now using AI-generated reporters. Here’s why

title: Lego announces Pokémon sets are coming next year
summary:
- Lego has announced that Pokémon building sets will be released in 2026.
- Specific details regarding the sets and characters are yet to be revealed, but Pikachu's tail is hinted at in the teaser.
- Previous Pokémon building sets were available through Mattel’s Mega line, but it’s unclear if Lego will have exclusivity in the future.

sources.title: Lego announces Pokémon sets are coming next year

title: Italian newspaper says it has published world’s first AI-generated edition
summary:
- Il Foglio claims to be the world's first newspaper published entirely by AI.
- The four-page edition is part of a month-long journalistic experiment.
- AI handled writing, headlines, quotes, and summaries, while journalists posed questions to the AI.
- The edition includes a story about US President Donald Trump and an article featuring Vladimir Putin.
- This initiative aims to explore AI's impact on journalism and editorial decisions.

sources.title: Italian newspaper says it has published world’s first AI-generated edition

title: Nanoleaf’s new immersive backlight kit plugs directly into your PC
summary:
- Nanoleaf has released a new PC Screen Mirror Lightstrip with 75 color-changing LEDs.
- The lightstrip plugs directly into a PC's USB port and requires no additional hardware.
- Available for preorder for $49.99, shipping expected by end of March 2025.
- Designed for monitors up to 32 inches, with a flexible adhesive design for easy installation.
- Allows users to choose from 16 million colors through the desktop app, can mirror gameplay colors, and serve as an audio visualizer.
- Features integration with Nanoleaf Premium subscription for advanced music sync capabilities.

sources.title: Nanoleaf’s new immersive backlight kit plugs directly into your PC

title: Google's New AI Models for Drug Discovery and Expanded Reddit Partnership
summary:
- Alphabet’s Google increased its collaboration with Reddit, enhancing search capabilities using Google’s Vertex AI.
- This partnership allows Google real-time access to Reddit’s API, improving information relevance on its platforms.
- A new open AI model, TxGemma, for drug discovery was announced, to be released via the Health AI Developer Foundations program.
- TxGemma can analyze text and therapeutic structures to assist in predicting new therapies’ properties.
- Uncertainty remains about the commercial use or customization of TxGemma.
- The AI drug discovery sector includes over 460 startups, with an investment of $60 billion thus far.

sources.title: Google expands Reddit partnership for AI-powered search
Google plans to release new ‘open’ AI models for drug discovery

title: WhatsApp will soon limit number of broadcast messages users and businesses can send
summary:
- WhatsApp will limit the number of broadcast messages that users and businesses can send to reduce spam.
- Testing will begin soon, with a suggested limit of 30 messages per month for individual users.
- Business accounts will see the introduction of a paid version for broadcast messaging, previously unlimited.
- Merchants will be able to send customized broadcast messages and schedule them, with 250 free messages available during the pilot.
- The changes aim to help users receive fewer overwhelming messages while still allowing businesses to communicate effectively.
- WhatsApp Business has become an important revenue source for Meta, with the new limits introducing a potential additional revenue stream for the company.

sources.title: WhatsApp will soon limit number of broadcast messages users and businesses can send

title: Exist is a new social wellness app that wants to help middle-age users find community
summary:
- Exist is an iOS social wellness app aimed at helping middle-aged users connect and build communities.
- The app features social journaling, daily mood tracking, audio exercises, and guided meditations.
- Founded by Jason Jardim and Alicia Waldner, it originally targeted Gen Z but shifted focus to middle-aged users as the average sign-up age became 40.
- Exist includes a TikTok-like feed for sharing journal entries and receiving community responses.
- Offers a free community journaling experience, with a subscription option for additional features at $5.99 per month.
- Future plans include enhancing human connection, adding sleep habit tracking, and personalized journal prompts.

sources.title: Exist is a new social wellness app that wants to help middle-age users find community

title: Google launches new healthcare-related features for Search, Android
summary:
• Google announced new healthcare-related features for Search, including expanded knowledge panels for health queries.
• A new mobile feature called 'What People Suggest' highlights user-generated content about health conditions.
• Google launched new medical records APIs globally for its Health Connect platform to streamline health data access.
• The Pixel Watch 3 will introduce a 'Loss of Pulse Detection' feature by the end of March, pending FDA clearance.
• Google is set to release new open AI models for drug discovery named TxGemma in the coming weeks.

sources.title: Google launches new healthcare-related features for Search, Android

title: One of the Wii U’s biggest adventures is now on the Switch
summary:
- The Switch benefits from Wii U’s failure as many inventive games are being ported.
- The latest addition is *Xenoblade Chronicles X*, which initially launched in 2015.
- The game features an expansive, unexplored world called Mira, home to various alien wildlife.
- Players settle and explore with missions that enhance map details similar to *Zelda* mechanics.
- The gameplay includes real-time battles and complex systems, requiring patience and strategy to succeed.
- *Xenoblade Chronicles X* is set to launch on the Switch on March 20th, 2025.

sources.title: One of the Wii U’s biggest adventures is now on the Switch

title: Baidu denies data leak in VP’s daughter controversy
summary:
- Baidu has denied a data breach related to its VP's daughter sharing private information online.
- Xie Guangjun's 13-year-old daughter claimed to have obtained data from her father, igniting speculation about a potential internal leak.
- The company’s head of security confirmed no data leak occurred and that employees, including Xie, do not have direct access to user databases.
- Xie publicly apologized on WeChat, expressing regret and acknowledging poor guidance for his daughter during an online argument that exposed personal details.

sources.title: Baidu denies data leak in VP’s daughter controversy

title: Apple's Legal Challenges Amidst Big Tech Regulations and Google's Monopoly Issues
summary:
- The Justice Department proposed that Google be required to divest the Chrome web browser due to monopoly concerns.
- In 2022, Google's revenue share payment to Apple as the default Safari search engine was approximately $20 billion, influencing Apple's profits.
- Apple attempted to intervene in the government lawsuit against Google but was denied, which raises concerns about its financial dependencies and potential legal issues for other tech firms like Meta and Amazon.
- Apple has lost its appeal regarding Germany’s regulatory controls aimed at major digital companies, which maintain a five-year designation on the company.
- The German court ruling, established in April 2023, enforces measures to promote fair competition among companies like Apple, Google, and Meta.
- Apple contends that it operates competitively and supports user privacy, disputing the court’s decision.

sources.title: What the breakup of Google could mean for Apple and other tech companies
Apple loses appeal against Germany’s special abuse control for Big Tech

title: How Trump and Musk built their own reality
summary:
- Donald Trump made a sales pitch for Tesla during a public appearance in front of the White House, standing next to Elon Musk.
- Protests against Tesla dealerships highlighted the growing resentment towards Musk, who has been perceived as an unelected leader.
- Spectacle has become a defining feature of the Trump era, as media blurs the line between reality and representation.
- The prevalence of conspiracy theories among Trump supporters reflects a fundamental disconnect with reality.
- Both Trump and Musk are experts in creating media spectacles, utilizing their respective platforms to gain influence and maintain power.
- Trump’s focus on television ratings has dictated many of his actions and decisions, often at the expense of effective governance.
- Musk's online behavior, including his tweets, plays a significant role in shaping public perception and market dynamics.
- The political landscape has shifted toward prioritizing entertainment value over factual reporting, as exemplified by networks like Fox News.
- Trump's administration has struggled economically, leading to significant impacts on consumer confidence and market stability.

sources.title: How Trump and Musk built their own reality

title: Google's New AI and Perplexity's Response to Image Editing Challenges
summary:
- Perplexity's new ad features Lee Jung-jae from *Squid Game*, humorously critiquing Google AI's suggestion of using glue for pizza cheese.
- Google’s AI Overviews criticized for inaccuracies, including the infamous glue recommendation.
- Perplexity aims to be a strong alternative to Google AI but also faces content plagiarism claims.
- Gemini 2.0 Flash enables true multimodal image outputs, maintaining character and setting continuity.
- Benchmarking shows Gemini 2.0 Flash excels in text integration within images compared to other models.
- The technology is still developing, with potential improvements in visual knowledge and output quality.

sources.title: Perplexity dunks on Google’s ‘glue on pizza’ AI fail in new ad
Farewell Photoshop? Google’s new AI lets you edit images by asking

title: Nvidia's Future Plans and RTX 50-Series GPU Launch Insights
summary:
- Nvidia GeForce RTX 5070 Ti is a cost-effective alternative to the RTX 4080.
- Launch concerns for RTX 5090 and 5080 raised due to potential rushing.
- RTX 5080 reviews indicate it may not meet high expectations.
- RTX 5090 performance demonstrated with 4K capabilities in games like Half-Life 2.
- Nvidia refutes claims about missing ROPs in RTX 50 laptop GPUs, testing ongoing.
- Early production issues reported for RTX 5080 and 5070 Ti, with replacement options active.
- Nvidia ranks No. 2 in Fast Company's World’s 50 Most Innovative Companies of 2025.
- As of Q3 2024, Nvidia has a 93% market share in GPUs for AI workloads.
- The new Blackwell processor offers up to 2.5 times more power and energy efficiency.
- Major clients include Google, Meta, Microsoft, OpenAI, Tesla, and xAI for Blackwell GPUs.
- Nvidia expands into sectors like drug discovery, autonomous vehicles, video production, and digital twins.

Nvidia, already the backbone of the AI boom, has big plans for the future

title: Glean’s AI platform learns everything to know about your company—and offers ways to help out
summary:
- Glean is ranked No. 6 on Fast Company’s list of the [World’s 50 Most Innovative Companies of 2025](https://www.fastcompany.com/most-innovative-companies/list).
- The platform provides an LLM-powered assistant that helps employees access and utilize internal data more effectively.
- Glean released [Glean Work AI](https://www.glean.com/product/overview) last year, allowing users to create AI agents for routine tasks using simple prompts.
- The company achieved an annual recurring revenue of $100 million in 2024 and raised $460 million in funding, bringing its valuation to $4.6 billion.

sources.title: Glean’s AI platform learns everything to know about your company—and offers ways to help out

title: Bumble is getting ID verification
summary:
- Bumble is rolling out optional ID verification, providing badges for users who confirm their identity with government-issued ID.
- The ID verification requires a passport or driver’s license, along with a selfie, and is currently available in 11 markets, including the US and UK.
- A new feature called Share Date allows users to share date plans with trusted contacts and update them through the app.
- Bumble will now alert users when sending messages that may violate community guidelines, assisting in promoting safer communication.
- These new features reflect similar capabilities offered by Tinder, which launched ID verification in Japan in 2019 and fully implemented it last year.

sources.title: Bumble is getting ID verification

title: The 10 most innovative security companies of 2025
summary:
- Fast Company highlights innovative security companies for 2025, including Abnormal Security, Nozomi Networks, Huntress, and Shift5.
- Cybercriminals netted over $9 trillion in 2024, making cybercrime a massive economy.
- Huntress protects over 150,000 customers with automation and monitoring, achieving $100 million in annual recurring revenue.
- Shift5 secures critical vehicles from cyber threats and anomalies, doubling revenue and customer base.
- Nozomi Networks introduced Arc Embedded to secure industrial control systems.
- Axiado offers hardware-based AI-driven solutions to enhance data center security and efficiency, raising significant funding.
- Abnormal Security leverages AI to detect fraud in communication apps, expanding rapidly with major financing and growth.

sources.title: The 10 most innovative security companies of 2025

title: The Most Innovative Companies in Space for 2025
summary:
- The list reflects global efforts in diversifying and securing launch and orbital services, essential for national security.
- SpaceX successfully launched its Starship and achieved a midair catch landing of its Super Heavy booster stage.
- Rocket Lab sent 12 Electron rockets into space, becoming the number three launch provider globally, and secured significant contracts.
- Arianespace successfully test-launched its Ariane 6 heavy-lift rocket as a step towards independent European space access.
- Iceye expanded its SAR microsatellite constellation, providing high-resolution coverage for various clients, including the U.S. Department of Defense and Ukraine.
- Innovations included a next-generation satellite bus deployment by Apex and weather-monitoring satellites from Muon Space.
- Intuitive Machines became the first private company to land on the Moon in February 2024.
- Questek developed superalloys for SpaceX’s Super Heavy boosters, and Stardog advanced AI for NASA programs.
- Skylo provided satellite connectivity services for major cellular providers to enable emergency communication.

sources.title: The Most Innovative Companies in Space for 2025

title: How DeepSeek engineered a hyper-efficient rival to ChatGPT
summary:
- DeepSeek ranked No. 12 on the World’s 50 Most Innovative Companies of 2025.
- Released two AI models that significantly reduce the computing power and capital requirements compared to Western models.
- Innovated mixture-of-experts architecture to enhance efficiency in model training and content generation.
- Developed a smaller model, DeepSeek-R1, utilizing reinforcement learning from its larger model, DeepSeek-V3.
- Shared research methods and open-sourced models, promoting transparency in cutting-edge AI.

sources.title: How DeepSeek engineered a hyper-efficient rival to ChatGPT

title: Innovations in Robotics and Engineering for 2025: Focus on Humanoid Robots
summary:
- The first depiction of a machine with a human brain was in [Metropolis](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolis_(film)) (1927).
- Humanoid robots are increasingly designed for human-like functions, aided by human-centric data training.
- These robots address labor shortages in aging populations.
- Nvidia's Jensen Huang emphasizes the significance of humanoids in AI advancements.
- Malaysia's first humanoid robot prototype faces challenges, discussed by Hanafiah Yussof.
- Interest in humanoid robots surged after Elon Musk's Optimus prototype reveal in 2022.
- UBTech Robotics launched the Tien Kung Xingzhe robot for research at around US$41,200.
- The robot, standing 1.7 meters tall, features advanced technologies like lidars and Nvidia’s Jetson Orin.
- It can walk at 10 km/h and navigate diverse terrains, with pre-orders expected to deliver in Q2 2025.
- Nearly 70 humanoid robots have been introduced since Tesla's Optimus launch, involving over 51 companies.
- The demand for humanoid robots is driven by labor shortages and advances in generative AI.
- Tesla aims to produce its first batch of humanoid robots this year.
- The article also discusses potential risks with humanoid robots, AI characters, and Microsoft’s Majorana 1 chip.
- Risks include unauthorized actions by humanoid robots and issues of AI character authenticity affecting youth.
- Microsoft’s Majorana 1 chip highlights the necessity for quantum-resistant algorithms for data security.
- The global robotics market is expected to exceed $100 billion by 2025, a significant rise from $17 billion a decade ago.
- Key indoor robot producers include FANUC and Apptronik; Percepto and CNH focus on outdoor applications.
- Simbe Robotics has raised $50 million for its Tally robots, enhancing retail inventory management.
- Apptronik, developing humanoid robots like Apollo, collaborates with Nvidia and Google for AI integration.
- Flock Safety uses drones for police work, reducing emergency response times significantly.
- GrayMatter Robotics enhances efficiency with AI to predict malfunctions, improving productivity.
- CNH's agricultural robots utilize AI for precision farming, boosting efficiency and reducing fuel consumption.
- Percepto provides a “drone-in-a-box” solution for automated industrial inspections and environmental hazard monitoring.
- Performance Drone Works manufactures military drones informed by conflict experiences, securing significant U.S. military contracts.

sources.title: Mapping the rise of humanoid robotics companies worldwide

Humanoid bots swap sci-fi for real life
3 Tech Advancements to Be Nervous About
The most innovative companies in robotics and engineering for 2025

title: The most innovative companies in manufacturing for 2025 + Foxconn unveils first AI model for manufacturing, supply chain
summary:
- Foxconn introduced 'FoxBrain', its first large language model for manufacturing and supply chain management.
- Trained on 120 Nvidia H100 GPUs for four weeks, based on Meta's Llama 3.1 architecture.
- Optimized for traditional Chinese and Taiwanese, capable of data analysis, decision support, document collaboration, problem-solving, and code generation.
- Initially for internal use; plans to collaborate with partners and share open-source elements.
- Training utilized Nvidia’s Taipei-1 supercomputer in Kaohsiung.
- More information to be revealed at Nvidia’s GTC developer conference later this month.
- Advances in manufacturing are often incremental rather than breakthroughs.
- Blackline Safety improves gas detection with real-time monitoring devices.
- Kraft Heinz enhances its supply chain using machine vision and digital twin modeling.
- Stratasys excels in additive manufacturing, introducing fast 3D printers for complex aerospace components.
- Gelato and Keychain build online marketplaces for on-demand printing and packaged goods.
- Dirtt Environmental Solutions customizes modular construction for commercial facilities.
- P2 Science launches sustainable cosmetic ingredients derived from upcycled materials.
- Keychain leverages AI to connect CPG brands with qualified manufacturers quickly.
- Blackline Safety's new monitor enables real-time hazardous gas detection, enhancing worker safety.
- HT Materials Science develops an additive to improve HVAC system efficiency.

sources.title: Foxconn unveils first AI model for manufacturing, supply chain
The most innovative companies in manufacturing for 2025

title: How these 10 gaming companies are keeping players engaged in inventive ways
summary:
- The video game industry faced significant layoffs and flat growth in 2024, following a pandemic-related boost in sales.
- Innovative companies have emerged, showcasing unique gaming strategies to engage players.
- **EA Sports** launched *College Football 25*, becoming the top-selling sports game in the U.S., integrating real college athletes into the game.
- **Bandai Namco** released *Tekken 8*, featuring an advanced tutorial mode that adapts to players' styles.
- **LocalThunk**'s *Balatro* became a viral success with over 2 million sales due to its unique poker-style gameplay.
- **Game Science**’s *Black Myth: Wukong* achieved massive sales, elevating China's game development on the global stage.
- **Our Odyssey** introduced *Overjoyed*, a tool for gamers with disabilities to enhance accessibility.
- **Inworld AI** developed an AI engine for dynamic NPC interactions in games, improving player engagement.
- **Pocket Worlds**' *Highrise* allows users to create and explore unique virtual spaces, showcasing the potential of user-generated content.

sources.title: How these 10 gaming companies are keeping players engaged in inventive ways

title: Why these 10 medical device makers are the most innovative in the world
summary:
- The medical devices industry is experiencing an unprecedented technology boom fueled by AI.
- HistoSonics offers the Edison histotripsy system, received FDA clearance in October 2023, with a 95.5% effectiveness rate in treating liver tumors.
- Heartflow uses an AI platform for comprehensive heart diagnostics, achieving 95% accuracy; utilized in 84% of top heart hospitals in the U.S.
- ROMTech has developed the PortableConnect for telemedicine rehabilitation, helping over 98,000 patients and saving costs compared to traditional therapy.
- Xenco Medical’s TrabeculeX Continuum aids in spinal surgery recovery, launched in January 2024, has been adopted in 52 hospitals.
- SprintRay enables rapid in-office dental prosthetics creation, sold over 7,000 devices in 2024, impacting nearly 600,000 patients.
- Cala Health’s Cala kIQ addresses essential tremors, 89% efficacy noted in a study with Medicare coverage across all states as of 2024.
- Medtronic received FDA clearance for its PulseSelect system for treating atrial fibrillation, benefiting 20,000 patients.
- Virtual Incision's MIRA robotic system for minimally invasive surgery received FDA approval, and was tested in space.
- The article recognizes the ongoing innovation in the medical device sector, highlighting significant advancements and their implications for patient care.

sources.title: Why these 10 medical device makers are the most innovative in the world

title: From cancer vaccines to COPD treatments, these 10 companies are developing innovative medicines
summary:
- In 2024, breakthroughs in drug treatments included Eli Lilly's Kisunla for Alzheimer's approved in July.
- Bristol Myers Squibb's Cobenfy receives FDA approval as the first new schizophrenia drug in 70 years in September.
- ARS Pharmaceuticals launched Neffy, a needle-free epinephrine nasal spray, in late September 2024.
- Notable advancements in cancer treated include T-cell therapies from Iovance and Adaptimmune.
- Verona Pharma's Ohtuvayre, approved on June 26, 2024, provides a new treatment for COPD.
- Pfizer's Hympavzi approved as a once-weekly treatment for hemophilia in October 2024.
- Innovative immunotherapy Anktiva gains FDA approval for bladder cancer in April 2024, enhancing effectiveness of BCG therapy.

sources.title: From cancer vaccines to COPD treatments, these 10 companies are developing innovative medicines

title: Innovative Data Science and Environmental Solutions in 2025
summary:
- U.K. startup, Epoch Biodesign, raised $18.3 million to boost production of plastic-eating enzymes.
- Founded in 2019, it's set to process 150 tonnes of plastic waste annually in its first facility.

- Kaspi serves 14 million users in Kazakhstan, which has a population of 20 million, and is seeking international expansion.

title: Alphabet nearing deal to acquire Wiz for $30b: sources + Google revives talks to acquire Wiz at higher valuation
summary:
- Google’s parent company Alphabet is in advanced talks to acquire Wiz at a higher valuation of around $30 billion.
- The previous deal talks were at a $23 billion valuation but fell through.
- Wiz, a cloud cybersecurity startup, has annual recurring revenue of $500 million and aims for $1 billion by 2025.
- The deal is complicated by whether Wiz will remain a separate division or be integrated into Google Cloud.
- Regulatory scrutiny under the Biden administration previously contributed to the breakdown of talks.
- Wiz was founded in 2020 by former Israeli military officers and has significant backers including Andreessen Horowitz and Sequoia.
- Alphabet is in advanced negotiations to acquire cybersecurity startup Wiz for approximately $30 billion.
- This acquisition would be Alphabet's largest to date if finalized.
- The deal may be completed soon if discussions proceed without issues.
- Wiz previously ended a $23 billion deal with Alphabet last year to focus on its IPO.

title: BYD Introduces Super Fast-Charging System; Tesla's Sales Plummet in China
summary:
- Tesla's sales in mainland China dropped to 30,688 vehicles in February 2025, a 51.5% decrease from January and a 49.2% year-over-year decline.
- February 2025 marks Tesla's lowest sales in China since July 2022, when 28,217 vehicles were delivered.
- The overall EV market in China saw a 3% decline in deliveries in February, totaling 720,000 units sold.
- BYD announced a new super e-platform charging system that can achieve peak speeds of 1,000 kW, allowing for 400 km of travel in just five minutes.
- BYD plans to deploy this technology in the Han L sedan and Tang L SUV, aiming to outperform Tesla’s superchargers, which max out at 500 kW.
- The company intends to create over 4,000 ultra-fast charging units in China, addressing 'charging anxiety' akin to petrol refueling.
- Increasing competition from Chinese EV manufacturers is impacting Tesla's stock and sales.

sources.title: Tesla’s sales drop 51% in China
BYD Unveils Super Fast-Charging System for Electric Vehicles

title: Cyber firm Armis cuts 45 jobs from its $120m acquired startup
summary:
- Cybersecurity firm Armis laid off 45 employees from Israeli startup Otorio, over half of its workforce.
- The layoffs followed Armis's US$120 million acquisition of Otorio in March.
- 25 of the affected employees were based in Israel; Otorio is left with 35 development staff.
- The restructuring impacts sales, marketing, finance, and HR departments.
- Otorio, founded in 2018, specializes in cybersecurity for sectors like oil, gas, and manufacturing.
- Otorio's Titan platform will be integrated into Armis’s Centrix suite to boost security for operational technology.
- This acquisition marks Armis's third within a year; the company raised US$200 million in October 2024, reaching a valuation of US$4.3 billion.
- Experts suggest the company may be preparing for an IPO, although Armis has not confirmed this.

sources.title: Cyber firm Armis cuts 45 jobs from its $120m acquired startup

title: Indian AI startup Unikon.ai shifts to D2C due to high cash burn
summary:
- Unikon.ai, co-founded by Aakash Anand in 2024, is shifting its business strategy due to high cash burn, with monthly expenses reaching 2 crore rupee (US$230,758).
- Anand announced that achieving profitability may take considerable time.
- The startup was initially an AI-powered networking platform connecting users with industry experts and educators.
- The company plans to transition into a direct-to-consumer (D2C) brand, leveraging Anand's past success in making D2C businesses profitable.
- In June 2024, Unikon.ai secured 16 crore rupee (US$2 million) in seed funding from investors like Zerodha’s Nikhil Kamath and Lenskart’s Peyush Bansal.
- This pivot emphasizes the company’s focus on a sustainable and profitable business model.

title: Alibaba’s AI Assistant Quark Launches with Advanced Features
summary:
- Alibaba has released an upgraded version of its Quark application, now using the Qwen-based reasoning model.
- Quark is the first consumer-facing service from Alibaba utilizing its proprietary AI models.
- Features include an AI chatbot, advanced research capabilities, and task execution tools for tasks like academic research, document drafting, image generation, medical diagnostics, and travel planning.
- All sellers are expected to use AI by 2025 as part of Alibaba's strategic plans.
- Quark was launched on March 13, 2025, and adapts to user intent automatically.
- The assistant has received positive feedback, particularly for its efficiency in answering cosmology questions.

title: Researchers surprised to find less-educated areas adopting AI writing tools faster
summary:
- Stanford researchers analyzed 305 million texts to study AI writing trends post-ChatGPT launch.
- AI language models assist in up to 25% of professional communications, with significant use in less-educated regions of the U.S.
- Rural areas adopted AI writing tools at lower rates overall, but regions with lower educational attainment showed higher usage than more educated areas.
- Adoption varied significantly by state, with Arkansas having the highest at 29.2% in consumer complaints.
- The study suggests AI writing tools may act as equalizers in diminishing communication barriers for less-educated populations.

sources.title: Researchers surprised to find less-educated areas adopting AI writing tools faster

- Engagement metrics indicate AI search users stay longer on sites, browse more pages, and are less likely to bounce.
- Google's generative AI search (AI Overviews) had several issues since its launch, including inaccuracies and user confusion.
- Perplexity, a startup offering AI search, has faced plagiarism controversies alongside notable financial valuation.
- OpenAI launched its AI search feature in ChatGPT, focusing on reducing weird outputs and emphasizing publisher control.

title: CFPB workers are reinstated after a court order, but many still can’t work
summary:
- The Consumer Financial Protection Bureau (CFPB) reinstated terminated probationary employees after a judge’s order.
- Approximately 70 probationary employees were terminated in February; the agency is required to restore them.
- Reinstated employees are still on administrative leave and cannot return to work until further notice.
- Employees will receive backpay from the date of termination, but their official files will not show a termination record.
- The CFPB headquarters remains closed, and some employees lack access to necessary systems and equipment.
- Ongoing union disputes claim attempts by the Trump administration to downsize the CFPB, which previously had about 1,700 employees.

title: Amazon is fighting the government’s efforts to get it to recall hazardous products
summary:

• Amazon argues it is a logistics provider and thus not obligated to carry out recalls as a distributor would be, calling the CPSC’s structure unconstitutional.
• In 2023, Amazon launched a product recall page, but continues to contest its legal obligations.

title: Significant Changes Ahead for Intel as Lip-Bu Tan Becomes CEO
summary:
- Intel's new CEO, Lip-Bu Tan, will earn a $1 million salary and $66 million in stock options/grants.
- Compensation package includes $14.4 million long-term stock grants, $17 million performance-based grants, and $9.6 million in stock options.
- He will also receive a $2 million annual bonus and may get accelerated vesting in case of a change in control at Intel.
- Tan was appointed CEO after the removal of Pat Gelsinger in December 2024.
- His appointment follows a 20% rise in Intel's stock this year.
- Tan has committed to purchasing $25 million in Intel shares as part of his compensation conditions.
- Lip-Bu Tan aims to implement significant changes in chip manufacturing and AI strategies.
- Potential actions include cutting middle management and revamping manufacturing approaches.
- Tan has warned of making 'tough decisions' to improve the struggling company.

title: Campaign to Limit Smartphone Use for Children and Strategies to Combat Doomscrolling
summary:
- An online campaign named [Smartphone Free Childhood](https://www.theguardian.com/society/2025/mar/13/campaign-to-bar-under-14s-from-having-smartphones-signed-by-100000-parents) has reached 100,000 signatures to restrict smartphone ownership for kids under 14.
- Aims to delay smartphone access until after year 9 and restrict social media use until age 16.
- Surrey has the most signatures (6,370); St Albans is targeting smartphone-free status for under 14s.
- Celebrity support from Paloma Faith, Benedict Cumberbatch, and Emma Barnett.
- Ofcom reports that 89% of 12-year-olds own smartphones, with half of kids under 13 using social media.
- Experts caution against total bans and recommend enhancing social media practices.
- Young adults (18-24) are asked to share their experiences with childhood smartphone use.
- Users are often addicted to social media platforms like Instagram and TikTok.
- Suggested methods to reduce usage include deleting distracting apps and utilizing built-in screen time controls.

- Developer Rhys Kentish created [Touch Grass](https://apps.apple.com/gb/app/touch-grass-reduce-screentime/id6739589530?ign-itscg=30200&ign-itsct=apps_box_badge&mttnsubad=6739589530), which locks apps until users photograph real grass.
- The app prevents substitutes like house plants; offers free app locking for two apps, with payments supporting [rewilding initiatives](https://www.rewildingbritain.org.uk/).
- Launched on March 17, 2025, the app has seen around 50,000 downloads.

- The prevalence of smartphones contributes to doomscrolling, which negatively affects mental health.
- Awareness of tech companies' design strategies can help users change habits.
- Implementing screen time limits can curtail social media use; options include Apple features and apps like [ScreenZen](https://apps.apple.com/us/app/screenzen-screen-time-control/id1541027222?platform=iphone) and [Opal](https://techcrunch.com/2022/09/15/opal-revamps-its-screen-time-app-to-help-anyone-not-just-parents-with-kids-focus-and-avoid-distractions/).
- Alternatives to scrolling include reading e-books through [Libby](https://libbyapp.com/) and playing games.

sources.title: Campaign to bar under-14s from having smartphones signed by 100,000 parents
Young people: what rules around smartphone use should be put in place for children?
Social media addicts: Here are tips to stop wasting time on apps
This app limits your screen time by making you literally touch grass
How to stop doomscrolling

title: Google's FireSat Satellite Launched to Combat Wildfires
summary:
- The first satellite of the FireSat constellation successfully launched on March 14, 2025.
- Aims to enhance wildfire detection and monitoring with updates every 20 minutes.
- Features six-band multispectral infrared cameras for distant detection.
- Collaborative effort among Google, Muon Space, and the Earth Fire Alliance.
- Fully operational constellation will include over 50 satellites.
- Provides five-meter resolution imagery and near real-time updates, addressing current tracking issues.
- Launched by SpaceX.

sources.title: Google and Muon Space launch a new satellite to battle wildfires
A Google-backed weapon to battle wildfires made it into orbit

title: Google's New AI Model Enables Watermark Removal from Images
summary:
- Google is expanding its experimental [Gemini 2.0 Flash AI](https://www.theverge.com/news/631203/google-gemini-flash-2-native-image-generation-watermark-removal) model to more developers globally.
- The AI can generate and edit images, including precise watermark removal.
- Competitors like [Watermark Remover.io](https://techcrunch.com/2025/03/17/people-are-using-googles-new-ai-model-to-remove-watermarks-from-images/) can also remove watermarks, but Gemini 2.0 Flash handles complex ones better.
- It can add an “edited with AI” mark post-removal, which can also be removed by AI.
- Currently, these tools are available to developers via AI Studio, lacking confirmed safeguards.
- Users are exploiting this AI model to remove watermarks from copyrighted images, including Getty Images.
- The model can fill gaps left by removed watermarks, raising copyright concerns.
- This capability is experimental, not meant for production, yet may trouble copyright holders due to unrestricted use.
- Removing watermarks without consent violates U.S. copyright law.

sources.title: Google’s Gemini AI is really good at watermark removal
People are using Google’s new AI model to remove watermarks from images

title: Mark Rober’s Tesla Video: Controversy and Analysis
summary:
- Mark Rober's video compares Tesla’s Autopilot with lidar-equipped vehicles by testing their braking before hitting a wall.
- The Tesla Model Y crashed into the wall while the lidar vehicle stopped successfully.
- The video garnered 10 million views in two days, praised for exposing Autopilot's shortcomings but also criticized for possible deception.
- Several claims from viewers suggest inconsistencies in the video, questioning whether Autopilot was active during the test.
- Rober released raw footage showing Autopilot was engaged moments before the crash, but critics argue it disengaged right before impact.
- Concerns have been raised regarding Rober's potential sponsorship by lidar company Luminar due to its prominent branding in the video.
- Rober denied any compensation from Luminar, claiming it was not a paid promotion.

sources.title: Mark Rober’s Tesla Video: Controversy and Analysis

title: Trump's Claims on Biden's Pardons and the Autopen Controversy
summary:
- Trump asserts that some of Biden's pardons are void because they were allegedly signed using an autopen.
- He claims that Biden was unaware of the pardons, citing a post on Truth Social.
- Critics point out that Trump's claims lack evidence, and Biden has publicly addressed the pardons.
- Autopen usage by presidents has historical precedent, with past presidents like Ford and Obama using them for signing documents.
- The Justice Department has previously indicated there is no legally prescribed method for executive clemency signature.
- Donald Trump claimed that Joe Biden's pardons are void because they were signed by an autopen.
- Autopens have been used by several presidents, starting with Harry Truman.
- Trump raised concerns about the legitimacy of Biden's pardons, stating they were done without Biden's knowledge.
- The autopen is a device that duplicates signatures using a robotic arm and pen, differing from digital signatures.

title: OpenAI to start testing ChatGPT connectors for Google Drive and Slack
summary:
- OpenAI is beta testing a feature called ChatGPT Connectors for business customers.
- The feature will enable integration with Google Drive and Slack for enhanced responses based on internal data.
- Future expansions to include platforms like Microsoft SharePoint and Box are planned.
- ChatGPT Connectors aims to facilitate use of internal knowledge similarly to web search.
- Concerns exist about ChatGPT accessing sensitive information; some businesses are cautious, while others are supportive.
- The connectors will sync encrypted copies of company files with ChatGPT, while maintaining strict adherence to user access permissions.
- Limitations include inability to analyze certain data types and restrictions on accessing private Slack messages.
- Companies interested in beta testing must provide 100 documents which will not be used for training but may help in synthetic data creation.

title: Elon Musk’s AI company, xAI, acquires a generative AI video startup
summary:
- Elon Musk’s AI company, xAI, has acquired Hotshot, a startup focusing on AI-powered video generation tools.
- Hotshot's CEO, Aakash Sastry, announced the acquisition via a post on X.
- The startup had developed three video foundation models over the past 2 years: Hotshot-XL, Hotshot Act One, and Hotshot.
- Hotshot was initially centered on AI-powered photo tools before pivoting to text-to-video models.
- The acquisition might lead to xAI developing competitive video generation models against Sora and Google’s Veo 2.
- Hotshot had previously received investments from notable VCs but undisclosed its funding rounds.
- Customers have until March 30 to download videos created using Hotshot, which began sunsetting new video creation on March 14.

sources.title: Elon Musk’s AI company, xAI, acquires a generative AI video startup

title: YC-backed ReactWise is applying AI to speed up drug manufacturing
summary:
- ReactWise, a YC-backed startup, is using AI to enhance chemical manufacturing, aiming to expedite drug production processes by 30 times.
- The firm plans to automate predictions for ideal experimental setups, potentially achieving this in two years.
- Founded in July 2024, ReactWise has secured $3.4 million in pre-seed funding and currently has 12 pilot trials with pharmaceutical companies, including some large players in the industry.

sources.title: YC-backed ReactWise is applying AI to speed up drug manufacturing

title: Klarna nabs Walmart away from Affirm and boosts its IPO prospects
summary:
- Klarna has announced a partnership to provide buy now, pay later loans for Walmart, taking over from Affirm.
- Klarna will implement the loan service through OnePay towards the end of this year.
- Affirm's stock fell 8% following the news, while Klarna's IPO filing indicates its recovery after a prior valuation drop.

sources.title: Klarna nabs Walmart away from Affirm and boosts its IPO prospects

title: Telegram founder, Pavel Durov, allowed to leave France — despite ongoing criminal investigation
summary:
- Pavel Durov, CEO of Telegram, allowed to leave France after modifying supervision conditions.
- Durov was arrested on August 24, 2024, over allegations of facilitating organized fraud and CSAM sharing.
- He initially had to pay €5 million bail and was barred from leaving France. These conditions have now changed.
- Investigation remains ongoing, and Durov still faces potential criminal trial in France.
- Telegram updated its policies post-arrest to enhance moderation and reporting of private chats.

sources.title: Telegram founder, Pavel Durov, allowed to leave France — despite ongoing criminal investigation

title: Texas man faces prison for activating ‘kill switch’ on former employer’s network
summary:
- Texas software developer Davis Lu faces up to 10 years in prison after being convicted of damaging his former employer’s network.
- Lu began sabotaging the systems after a corporate restructuring in 2018 reduced his responsibilities.
- He created a 'kill switch' that locked all employees out of the network when his credentials were deactivated, which activated upon his departure on September 9, 2019.
- The disruption affected thousands of employees and caused significant financial losses to the company.
- Sentencing is scheduled for June 23.

sources.title: Texas man faces prison for activating ‘kill switch’ on former employer’s network

title: Xiaomi 15 Ultra and Nothing Phone 3A Announced, Pixel 9A Leaks Ahead of Launch
summary:
- Xiaomi announced the 15 Ultra flagship phone in China, starting at 6,499 yuan (~$893).
- Features a 200MP periscope camera optimized for low light, launching internationally on March 2 at Mobile World Congress.
- New periscope lens supports 4.3x zoom, main camera fixed aperture of f/1.63, powered by Snapdragon 8 Elite chipset.
- Nothing Phone 3A and 3A Pro launched, with prices starting at $379 and $459, featuring Snapdragon 7S Gen 3, 12 GB RAM, and 256 GB storage.
- Both models include a 50MP main camera; the Pro has a 3x telephoto lens.
- New Essential Space feature uses AI to organize media; both phones ship with Android 15 and three years of updates.
- Leaked videos of the Pixel 9A show a 6.3-inch display, a 48MP main camera, and a 5,100mAh battery, expected reveal on March 19.

sources.title: Xiaomi 15 Ultra is a small update with a big periscope lens
Xiaomi 15 Ultra review: ugly phone, beautiful camera
Nothing’s Phone 3A and 3A Pro use AI to organize all your stuff
Pixel 9A leaks in review videos before it’s even announced

title: TikTok’s Tunnel Girl is digging again—much to the internet’s delight
summary:
- TikTok's ‘Tunnel Girl’, known as Kala, has received permission to resume her tunnel project after it was previously shut down due to lack of permits.
- Kala has gained a following of over 657,000 on TikTok by documenting her digging project in Herndon, Virginia, which she began as a hobby in 2022.
- The tunnel currently extends 22 feet below ground and features a 30-foot entrance; future expansion may require additional permits and engineering evaluations.

sources.title: TikTok’s Tunnel Girl is digging again—much to the internet’s delight

title: Trump Administration's Crackdown on Student Protests at Columbia University
summary:
- The Trump administration is enforcing stricter regulations on university speech, beginning with Columbia University.
- DHS agents raided Columbia, investigating student protesters for possible violations of federal terrorism laws.
- Columbia faces pressure to discipline student activists or risk losing federal funding.
- Several students, including Grant Miner, were expelled or suspended for their protest involvement.
- Mahmoud Khalil's immigration case illustrates the use of a McCarthy-era statute for deportation.
- Student activists are legally challenging the university's response to government demands.
- Khalil, detained by ICE, faces a precarious legal situation with possible deportation.
- Future actions against student demonstrators may occur, with the administration linking activism to antisemitism.
- Colleges may be required to enhance internal law enforcement and place departments under federal oversight.

sources.title: The Trump administration is coming for student protesters
Trump’s first 100 days: all the news affecting the tech industry

title: Snap’s AR Spectacles Introduce GPS and Virtual Keyboard Features
summary:
- Snap has launched new features for its Spectacles AR glasses including GPS and hand-tracking capabilities.
- Developers can now create Lenses using geo-location data and custom locations for enhanced location-based experiences.
- New applications like [NavigatAR](https://techcrunch.com/2025/03/17/snap-expands-spectacles-capabilities-with-gps-and-hand-tracking-features/) from Utopia Labs use Snap Map Tiles to assist users.
- Users can now also track hand gestures and see when they are holding a phone, adding to interaction possibilities.
- A leaderboard feature can be added for competitive Lenses, and a new AR keyboard is introduced.
- Spectacles are available through a $99/month developer program, with a 50% discount for educators and students.
- Snap's Spectacles now feature GPS for navigation and improved hand tracking.
- An AR keyboard allows for text entry without a connected smartphone.
- New AR capabilities include location-based gaming and walking course development for users.
- Spectacles remain developer-only, requiring a $99 monthly rental commitment for at least a year.

sources.title: Snap expands Spectacles capabilities with GPS and hand-tracking features
Snap’s AR Spectacles now support a virtual keyboard and GPS

title: Netflix built an army of servers to stream TV—now it’s powering games
summary:
- Netflix established its own content delivery network, Open Connect, distributing over 18,000 servers across 175 countries.
- The company is developing cloud gaming infrastructure to enable Netflix members to play games on smart TVs without consoles.
- Netflix's servers have evolved significantly, improving performance by 40 times since their inception in 2011, incorporating modern technology for efficient streaming.

sources.title: Netflix built an army of servers to stream TV—now it’s powering games

title: TikTok rolls out a ‘Security Checkup’ tool to help users secure their accounts
summary:
- TikTok introduces a new “Security Checkup” tool for users to review and update their account security settings.
- The tool can be accessed via “Settings and privacy” and “Security and permissions” from the user’s profile.
- It guides users through security features, encouraging them to enable enhanced security options like phone number linking and two-step verification.
- Users are reminded to check active devices and may enable biometric authentication for secure logins.
- TikTok monitors for unusual behavior, notifying users through the app.
- The rollout happens amidst ongoing uncertainty regarding TikTok's operation in the U.S. following a deadline extension to the app's ban by President Trump.

sources.title: TikTok rolls out a ‘Security Checkup’ tool to help users secure their accounts

title: Max just wiped its classic Looney Tunes lineup
summary:
- Warner Bros. Discovery removed the entire lineup of classic Looney Tunes shorts (1930-1969) from its streaming service, Max.
- The company confirmed the focus will shift to adult and family programming rather than kids' content.
- This follows earlier removals of Looney Tunes episodes at the end of 2022 and confusion over the series' availability.
- Newer Looney Tunes content remains available on Max.
- This content purge is part of broader cuts following David Zaslav's takeover of Warner Bros. Discovery.
- Max had also ended its streaming deal for Sesame Street and made notable content changes under the new administration.

sources.title: Max just wiped its classic Looney Tunes lineup

title: DOGE Staffer Violated Treasury Rules by Emailing Unencrypted Personal Data
summary:
- A DOGE staffer, Marko Elez, violated Treasury policy by sending unencrypted personal data to Trump administration officials.
- Elez had previously resigned due to racist social media posts, but was rehired by DOGE.
- 19 state attorneys general are suing the Treasury over DOGE's system access, which has been limited due to Elez's actions.
- The security breach was revealed during an investigation into Elez's laptop and email account.
- Shared data included sensitive transaction details like names and amounts of money.

sources.title: A DOGE staffer broke Treasury policy by emailing unencrypted personal data
DOGE staffer violated Treasury rules by emailing unencrypted personal data

title: Travis Kalanick wants to do a lot more than develop more ghost kitchens
summary:
- Travis Kalanick shared his vision for CloudKitchens at the [Abundance Summit](http://abundance360.com/summit) in Los Angeles.
- Kalanick aims to evolve CloudKitchens from providing restaurant spaces to delivering AI-optimized meals directly to customers.
- He draws parallels between his business model and past industry disruptors like Uber and Zynga.
- Kalanick expressed concerns about restaurants relying on third-party platforms like Uber Eats and DoorDash.
- He emphasized the concept of cooking-as-a-service and the goal of making healthy meals universally accessible.
- AI's role in the future of food services was highlighted, emphasizing real-world applications beyond just digital interactions.
- Kalanick and fellow entrepreneur Marc Lore are targeting a future where AI enhances meal planning and health monitoring for consumers.
- Both CloudKitchens and Lore's venture Wonder have raised substantial investments, with Wonder acquiring GrubHub last November.

sources.title: Travis Kalanick wants to do a lot more than develop more ghost kitchens

title: Relying on AI chatbots for hospital care is ‘reckless and dangerous’ say human nurses
summary:
- Hospitals increasingly using AI to monitor patient vital signs and assist with care plans, raising concerns among nursing unions.
- National Nurses United organized over 20 demonstrations advocating for nurses' rights in AI usage and protection from automated advice.
- AI can cause false alarms and dangerous advice; nurses emphasize the importance of human judgment in patient care.

sources.title: Relying on AI chatbots for hospital care is ‘reckless and dangerous’ say human nurses

title: How TikTok is emerging as an essential tool for migrant smugglers
summary:
- Social media apps like TikTok are increasingly used by migrant smugglers and migrants, providing insights into the smuggling industry.
- Smugglers adapt to changing environments and use technology to reach new audiences, moving away from traditional networks.
- A significant 2023 UN study found that 64% of migrants had access to smartphones and the internet during their journey to the U.S.
- TikTok content features alarming trends, with posts advertising smuggling services and showcasing the conditions faced by migrants.
- Concerns are raised by authorities regarding the sophistication of smuggling networks and the potential for exploitation of migrants through social media.

sources.title: How TikTok is emerging as an essential tool for migrant smugglers

title: Forrest Li confirms candidacy for SG football chief
summary:
- Forrest Li, billionaire and Sea Limited founder, announces candidacy for the presidency of the Football Association of Singapore (FAS).
- Announcement made on March 17; elections scheduled for April 28.
- Li plans to share details about his team and vision for Singapore football soon.
- Former FAS council member from 2017 to 2021; oversaw the privatization of the Lion City Sailors in 2020.

sources.title: Forrest Li confirms candidacy for SG football chief

title: Xbox 360 consoles can now be hacked with just a USB key
summary:
- Xbox 360 modders have a new software exploit called [BadUpdate](https://github.com/grimdoomer/Xbox360BadUpdate) that allows running unsigned code via a USB key.
- The method enables access to the homebrew store, which includes games, apps, emulators, and utilities without opening the console.
- Limitations include needing to manually patch executables and the exploit’s reliability can vary, requiring reactivation on each console boot.

sources.title: Xbox 360 consoles can now be hacked with just a USB key

title: SG’s Creative Technology lays off 14% of its employees
summary:
- Creative Technology, based in Singapore, has laid off about 40 employees, which is 14% of its workforce.
- Affected departments included sales and marketing.
- The company currently has over 280 employees, a significant reduction from its numbers in the early 2000s.
- Creative reported a net loss of US$6.1 million for the first half of its fiscal year ending Dec. 31, 2024, up from a loss of US$4.1 million the previous year.
- Despite an 18% increase in net sales to US$37.4 million, financial challenges persist, attributed to market decline.
- The company is in search of a new CEO following Song Siow Hui's retirement in February 2025, after the death of founder Sim Wong Hoo in January 2023.

sources.title: SG’s Creative Technology lays off 14% of its employees

title: Catcha Digital unit to acquire 60% stake in Framemotion
summary:
- Catcha Digital, through its subsidiary iMedia Asia, plans to acquire 60% stake in Framemotion Studio for 37.32 million ringgit (around US$8.39 million) in cash.
- The acquisition involves purchasing 600,000 shares of Framemotion, a digital media advertising solutions provider.
- Framemotion is expected to achieve a profit after tax of at least 6.8 million ringgit (around US$1.5 million) in the first year post-acquisition.
- A similar profit target is set for the following year as well. 
- The deal aims to leverage Catcha Digital’s digital advertising expertise with Framemotion’s strengths in virtual and augmented reality content.

sources.title: Catcha Digital unit to acquire 60% stake in Framemotion

title: TechCrunch All Stage 2025 Event Agenda and Opportunities for Founders
summary:
- TechCrunch All Stage event scheduled for **July 15, 2025** in Boston at SoWa Power Station.
- Open call for speakers ends on **April 18, 2025**.
- Expected attendance of **1,200** individuals, fostering networking between founders and VCs.
- Engagement features breakout sessions and roundtable discussions.
- Founder reviews indicate a need for transparency in VC dealings.
- Contributions encouraged from founders, VCs, and experts at [TechCrunch All Stage 2025](https://techcrunch.com/events/techcrunch-all-stage-2025/?utm_source=tc&utm_medium=post&utm_campaign=tcallstage2025&utm_content=post_callforcontent_02282025&promo=post_callforcontent_02282025&display=).
- Speaker applications must focus on startup scaling and are due by **April 18, 2025**.
- Exhibit tables priced at **$5,500**, providing visibility to a growing audience.
- Only **eight exhibit tables** available, with each including six full-access passes and networking opportunities.
- Agenda covers two main stages: **Foundation Stage** and **Scale Stage**.
- Topics in Foundation Stage include VC evaluations at Pre-Seed, AI MVPs, market reshaping, and pitching.
- Scale Stage engages with themes like scaling sustainable companies and fundraising beyond Series C.
- Featured speakers include investors and entrepreneurs from firms such as Precursor Ventures, Underscore.vc, and others.
- All attendees receive presentation transcripts and networking opportunities.
- **Event Date**: July 15, 2025; **Foundation Stage Topics** cover various startup aspects, while **Scale Stage** includes discussions on scaling and raising funds.
