title: Turing raises $111M at $2.2B valuation; Zetwerk secures $5M in funding
summary:
- Bengaluru-based B2B manufacturing startup Zetwerk has raised US$5 million in a funding round co-led by Arc Investments and Oriental Biotech Limited.
- The company issued 9,93,721 series F3 compulsorily convertible preference shares (CCPS) priced at US$4.98 each.
- Arc Investments and Oriental Biotech each contributed US$1.15 million, with Stargazer Fund-I investing US$575,205, and additional funds from angel investors.
- This funding round is reportedly ongoing with potential for further capital to be raised soon.

- Turing raises $111 million in Series E funding, doubling its valuation to $2.2 billion.
- The company reports an annualized revenue run rate of $167 million and is profitable.
- Khazanah Nasional Berhad leads the funding round, joined by several other investors.
- Turing originally started as an HR tech startup but shifted focus to developing AI coding solutions after working with OpenAI.

sources.title: Indian supply chain startup Zetwerk bags $5m
Turing, a key coding provider for OpenAI and other LLM producers, raises $111M at a $2.2B valuation

title: 1Password is making it easier to find passwords based on your location
summary:
- 1Password introduces a new feature allowing users to find passwords based on their physical location.
- Users can add locations to items using a map view or while at a specific location.
- The app will present relevant passwords in the 'Nearby' section based on proximity.
- Users can limit visible items to locations within a specified range (50 feet to 10 miles).
- Location data is stored locally on devices and is not shared or tracked, ensuring user privacy.
- This feature was previously available in 1Password labs, where users could test new functionalities.

sources.title: 1Password is making it easier to find passwords based on your location

title: NASA is making sacrifices to keep the Voyager mission alive
summary:
- The twin Voyager spacecraft have been on a historic mission for 47 years, traveling farther than any human-made objects.
- Due to depleting nuclear batteries, NASA is shutting down some science instruments to conserve power.
- On February 25th, Voyager 1’s cosmic ray subsystem was turned off, with Voyager 2’s low-energy charged particle instrument scheduled for shutdown on March 24th.
- Each probe will then have three out of ten original scientific instruments still operational.
- NASA anticipates the shutdowns will extend the mission's life for another year.
- The Voyagers are expected to continue functioning into the 2030s with careful power management and further planned shutdowns of instruments.

sources.title: NASA is making sacrifices to keep the Voyager mission alive

title: The Corvette ZR1’s 233-mph run had to start in a virtual world
summary:
- The Chevrolet Corvette ZR1 set a record 233 mph last October on a closed track in Papenburg, Germany.
- It is the fastest production car available for under $1 million, with a starting price of $174,995.
- Extensive simulations were conducted to optimize performance, achieving a top speed prediction accuracy of less than 0.5%.
- The engineering team faced challenges with real-world data versus simulated performance, discovering the ZR1's actual output was down by 80 horsepower during tests.
- Final adjustments included raising the rev limit by 100 rpm to avoid hitting the limiter during runs.
- Testing conditions were ideal, with cool temperatures and minimal wind aiding the record-setting attempts.

sources.title: The Corvette ZR1’s 233-mph run had to start in a virtual world

title: A year later, OpenAI still hasn’t released its voice cloning tool
summary:
- OpenAI announced a preview of its voice cloning tool, Voice Engine, in March 2024, but it remains in preview a year later without a public launch date.
- The company remains cautious about the tool's release, citing concerns over potential misuse and regulatory scrutiny.
- Voice Engine has been in development since 2022 and aims to generate realistic speech while ensuring user safety through features like watermarking and consent requirements.

sources.title: A year later, OpenAI still hasn’t released its voice cloning tool

title: DuckDuckGo is amping up its AI search tool — but will still let you leave it behind
summary:
- DuckDuckGo's AI-generated answers now source information from across the web.
- AI chatbot will integrate web search and allow users to control response frequency.
- Features support for multiple AI models and enhancements like uploading images and voice interaction are planned.
- DuckDuckGo emphasizes user privacy, storing data locally and not using it for AI training.
- The service will remain free, with potential premium features in future subscription plans.

sources.title: DuckDuckGo is amping up its AI search tool — but will still let you leave it behind

title: The Trump administration just cut Defense Department grants that research terrorism and drug trafficking
summary:
- Grants from the Department of Defense's Minerva Research Initiative are being terminated, risking research and employment for many involved.
- The Minerva program has funded crucial social science research on national security since 2008, addressing topics like Russian propaganda and U.S. military deployments.
- The recent funding cuts represent a shift in priorities under the Trump administration, despite the program's bipartisan support and relatively low annual cost.

sources.title: The Trump administration just cut Defense Department grants that research terrorism and drug trafficking

title: How Audiomack became an unlikely Spotify competitor
summary:
- Audiomack is gaining popularity as a competitor to Spotify, especially in West Africa.
- The platform's current No. 1 album belongs to Nigerian artist Seyi Vibez, with 1.8 billion plays.
- Audiomack has 40 million monthly listeners, with half from Africa, demonstrating its strong local market presence.
- Founded in 2012 by Zisook and Macli to help local hip-hop DJs distribute mixtapes, Audiomack's growth surged in 2019 with West African users.
- The company hired a local team in Nigeria to better understand the market and avoid viewing Africa as a singular entity.

sources.title: How Audiomack became an unlikely Spotify competitor

title: YouTube Enhances Bedtime Reminders; TikTok Revamps Desktop Platform
summary:
- TikTok revamps its desktop platform to compete with YouTube, introducing several new features.
- New features include a modular layout, refreshed For You feed, Explore tab, immersive full-screen gaming, and a floating player.
- A Collections feature allows users to organize favorite videos into custom categories, similar to YouTube's Playlists.
- Desktop users can only use a floating player on Google Chrome for multitasking while watching content.
- TikTok aims to provide a more immersive viewing experience aligned with its mobile interface.
- The platform continues to evolve by increasing video upload limits and enhancing long-form content features.

- Teenage YouTube users globally will receive automatic reminders to go to bed and take breaks from screens.
- These reminders, first introduced in the U.S. seven years ago, are now toggled on by default for minors as of 2023.
- Effectiveness of the reminders is questionable, as users can easily dismiss them.
- YouTube's 'take a break' notification began in 2018, with over three billion warnings sent by 2020.
- Concerns about teen mental health have grown, prompting YouTube to make reminders more prominent in 2023.
- TikTok has also implemented similar features for screen time management for users under 18.

sources.title: In challenge to YouTube, TikTok revamps its desktop platform
YouTube is doubling down on ‘bedtime’ reminders. Do they work?

title: VCs don’t want no frauds + The VC playbook for preventing another eFishery scandal
summary:
- The eFishery scandal has highlighted governance failures in Southeast Asia’s startup ecosystem, leading to calls for stronger oversight.
- eFishery, once a celebrated success, faces financial unsustainability due to fraud allegations, resulting in significant investor losses.
- VCs are encouraged to conduct deeper due diligence, ensuring that tech works and market sizes are real, and distinguishing between genuine traction and inflated metrics.
- Annual financial audits are insufficient; businesses need investigative audits to verify revenue legitimacy and uncover fraud risks.
- There is a need for more whistleblowers to report inconsistencies and fraud within startups.
- The article discusses the implications of the eFishery scandal and the potential for future frauds in venture capital (VC).
- Tips for VCs to avoid fraud include involving local experts in due diligence, verifying revenue with investigative audits, and establishing whistleblower frameworks.
- Highlights additional news such as Alta, an Israeli firm raising US$7 million, and Tencent’s Yuanbao becoming the most downloaded app in China’s iOS App Store.

sources.title: The VC playbook for preventing another eFishery scandal
VCs don’t want no frauds

title: Singapore Authorities File Additional Charges in Server Fraud Case
summary:
- Singapore authorities filed additional charges against three men in a server fraud case.
- The case involves allegations of defrauding [Super Micro](https://www.techinasia.com/news/singapore-files-additional-charges-in-server-fraud-case) and making false statements about [Dell servers](https://www.techinasia.com/news/singapore-file-additional-charges-in-server-fraud-case).
- Investigators are looking into 22 individuals and firms over false claims regarding Nvidia chips, with potential US export violations under scrutiny.
- Legal actions stem from servers allegedly sent to Malaysia.
- Forensic analysis has begun on 42 seized devices, with international cooperation on financial transactions.
- The additional charges were filed on Mar. 6, 2025.

sources.title: Singapore authorities files additional charges in server fraud case
Singapore authorities file additional charges in server fraud case

title: ‘Trump Gaza’ AI video intended as political satire, says creator
summary:
- The creator of the ‘Trump Gaza’ video, Solo Avital, intended it as political satire.  
- The AI-generated video shows a surreal image of Gaza as a luxurious paradise with Trump and Netanyahu.  
- Avital created the video in under eight hours using AI tools and shared it with friends before its viral spread.  
- Trump shared the video on his Truth Social account on February 26, 2025, without any context.  
- Avital expressed surprise at the reactions and noted the media's portrayal of AI-generated content.  
- Hany Farid, a professor, emphasized the potential dangers of AI-generated videos misused for misinformation.

sources.title: ‘Trump Gaza’ AI video intended as political satire, says creator

title: Renaissance Fusion raises €32M to radically simplify complex fusion reactors
summary:
- Renaissance Fusion secured €32 million in Series A1 funding led by Crédit Mutuel Impact’s Révolution Environnementale et Solidaire fund and Lowercarbon Capital.
- The funds will be used to build a demonstrator for a simplified stellarator fusion reactor design, aiming for completion by the end of 2026.
- The innovative design incorporates segmented tubes and high-temperature superconducting magnets, with a focus on reducing manufacturing complexity and costs for fusion technology.

sources.title: Renaissance Fusion raises €32M to radically simplify complex fusion reactors

title: Ex-SoftBank exec’s son raises $150m for Indian tech startups
summary:
- Rohan Misra, son of former SoftBank Vision Fund chief Rajeev Misra, launches Gravity Holdings fund.
- The fund has raised $150 million, mainly from undisclosed domestic family offices and senior executives.
- Gravity Holdings will focus on growth-stage investments in Indian tech startups.
- More details about the fund's future plans are anticipated soon.

sources.title: Ex-SoftBank exec’s son raises $150m for Indian tech startups

title: Alibaba stock jumps 7.5% after AI model announcement
summary:
- Alibaba Group's stock rose by 7.5% on Mar. 6, marking the largest increase in nearly two weeks.
- This surge followed the announcement of its open-source AI model, QwQ-32B, which was introduced the same day.
- The QwQ-32B model competes with DeepSeek’s R1 while using only 5% of the data parameters, enhancing efficiency.
- The stock rise is attributed to increased investor confidence and Alibaba's recent recovery from regulatory issues.
- Alibaba's market value has increased by approximately US$135 billion this year.

sources.title: Alibaba stock jumps 7.5% after AI model announcement

title: Canoo's CEO Purchases Bankrupt EV Startup Assets for $4 Million
summary:
- Canoo's CEO, Anthony Aquila, is purchasing nearly all assets of the bankrupt EV startup for $4 million.
- The sale will eliminate over $11 million in debt owed by Canoo to Aquila's financial firm.
- Canoo filed for Chapter 7 bankruptcy just six weeks prior, citing $145 million in assets against $175 million in liabilities.
- Other offers for Canoo's assets can be submitted before March 28.
- The bankruptcy trustee supports the sale due to a lack of financing options for EV manufacturing and the high number of available assets from failed startups.
- CEO Anthony Aquila proposed to buy nearly all assets of Canoo after its Chapter 7 bankruptcy filing.
- He offered US$4 million in cash for the acquisition through WHS Energy Solutions, Inc.
- The deal would eliminate over US$11 million in debt owed to a financial firm controlled by Aquila.
- Other bidders have until Mar. 28 to submit competing offers for the assets.

sources.title: Canoo’s CEO is buying the bankrupt EV startup’s assets
EV startup Canoo CEO to buy assets after bankruptcy

title: Chipmaker Marvell Technology sees $1.9b revenue forecast
summary:
- Marvell Technology projected Q1 revenue of $1.88 billion, slightly above estimates of $1.87 billion.
- Shares fell by 15% in after-hours trading on Mar. 5 due to concerns over AI growth.
- Data center revenues rose 78% year-on-year in Q4, reaching $1.37 billion, driven by demand for AI chips.
- In December 2024, Marvell signed a five-year agreement with Amazon for custom AI chips.

sources.title: Chipmaker Marvell Technology sees $1.9b revenue forecast

title: YouTube launches ad-free video streaming for $7.99 per month
summary:
- YouTube has launched a subscription service called "Premium Lite" for $7.99 per month.
- The Premium Lite plan offers an ad-free experience on most videos, excluding ad-free music access.
- This plan differs from current options: the $13.99 Premium plan for ad-free videos and music, and the $10.99 Music Premium plan focusing solely on ad-free music videos.

sources.title: YouTube launches ad-free video streaming for $7.99 per month

title: Why Shopee is key to SeaMoney’s success
summary:
- Shopee overtook Lazada to become Southeast Asia’s largest ecommerce platform, maintaining its lead into 2024.
- Shopee recorded positive annual adjusted earnings for the first time in 2024, with a projected gross merchandise value increase of 20%.
- In Q4 2024, nearly half of SPX Express deliveries in Asia were completed within two days.
- The article discusses Sea Group’s second profitable year, largely fueled by Shopee’s growth and adjacent lending business.

sources.title: Why Shopee is key to SeaMoney’s success

title: Bolt claims 540% surge in driver-partners across Malaysia
summary:
- Bolt experienced a 540% growth in driver-partners and a 280% increase in registered passengers within three months of launching in Malaysia.
- The platform's low 15% commission rate enhances drivers' earnings, contributing to over 22.8 million ringgit (US$5.15 million) in driver revenue.
- Bolt introduced activation bonuses and daily campaigns to support driver engagement, alongside the launch of Bolt Executive for premium ride services.

sources.title: Bolt claims 540% surge in driver-partners across Malaysia

title: Afore Capital Launches $185M Fund; Peak XV Investor Moves On After 9 Years
summary:
- Afore Capital has launched a new $185 million fund and a program called pre-seed 2.0.
- The firm claims to be the largest dedicated pre-seed investor, with a portfolio valuation over $13.5 billion.
- They aim to provide flexible investment amounts, catering to both established founders and those in the ideation phase.
- Afore is starting an 8-week Founders-in-Residence (FIR) program to assist early-stage founders in exploring startup ideas without the immediate pressure to fundraise.
- The new fund will invest in 35 to 40 pre-seed companies and support 50 to 75 founders through the FIR program.

- Shraeyansh Thakur leaves Peak XV Partners after over nine years.
- He announced his decision on LinkedIn to pursue an entrepreneurial venture.
- Thakur joined Peak XV in 2015 and worked with startups like Meesho, CARS24, and Unacademy.
- He previously held roles at RBS and Standard Chartered.

sources.title: Pre-seed firm Afore Capital has a fresh $185M fund and a new program to help founders discover ideas
Peak XV investor departs after 9 years

title: Amazon Prime Video adds AI dubbing for English, Spanish
summary:
- Amazon Prime Video launches AI-aided dubbing for select movies and series starting **Mar. 5, 2025**.
- Initially supports **English and Spanish** for **12 titles** lacking dubbing options.
- Aims to enhance global accessibility for content across its platform with over **200 million customers** worldwide.
- Part of a broader trend of media companies utilizing AI to improve user experience.

sources.title: Amazon Prime Video adds AI dubbing for English, Spanish

title: WeChat mini-game advertising surges 113%: report
summary:
- WeChat mini-game advertising sector experienced a 113% year-over-year growth in 2024.
- Over 18,400 mini-games launched ads from January to October 2024, up from 8,600 in the same period of 2023.
- Total creatives produced reached 3.7 million between January and October 2024, doubling from 1.8 million in 2023.
- Full-year estimates suggest the total number of creatives could reach 4.3 million.
- The report highlights the need for high-quality creative optimization as market competition increases.

sources.title: WeChat mini-game advertising surges 113%: report

title: Ola Group, Lenovo to build India’s largest supercomputer
summary:
- Krutrim, an AI company under Ola Group, is partnering with Lenovo to develop India’s largest supercomputer.
- The announcement was made at Lenovo TechWorld India 2025.
- Ola Group's chief investment officer Navendu Agarwal stated the supercomputer will utilize Krutrim’s cloud capabilities and AI models.
- Krutrim is training its “Krutrim 3” model on 700 billion parameters, backed by Ola’s US$230 million investment, with plans for US$1 billion next year.
- As part of the IndiaAI Mission, Lenovo aims to enhance manufacturing and R&D in India, producing all AI-powered PCs locally by 2028 and launching India-made AI servers starting April 1.

sources.title: Ola Group, Lenovo to build India’s largest supercomputer

summary:
- The war in Ukraine has increased demand for counter-drone systems.  
- German startup Alpine Eagle develops Sentinel, an airborne counter-drone system designed for cost efficiency.  
- The startup secured €10.25 million in Series A funding, with the German army as its launch customer and plans to expand into the U.K. market.

title: US court dismisses Intel shareholder suit over layoffs
summary:
- A US district court dismissed a shareholder lawsuit against Intel on Mar. 4.
- The suit claimed Intel hid problems in its foundry business, leading to job cuts and suspended dividends.
- The case followed Intel's reported US$7 billion operating loss for fiscal 2023, revealed in April 2024.

summary:
- Smiles and Tencent Cloud partner to enhance digital commerce in the UAE.
- Partnership announced at the Mobile World Congress 2025 in Barcelona.
- Smiles will implement Tencent Cloud’s Super App as a Service solution, enabling businesses to have 'mini apps' in the Smiles platform, similar to WeChat.
- The integration aims to provide consumers with more services and rewards on a single app.

title: GenAI platform Phot.AI bags $2.7m seed funding
summary:
- Phot.AI, an AI-driven creative automation platform based in India, has raised $2.7 million in seed funding.
- The funding round was led by Info Edge Ventures, with participation from Together Fund, AC Ventures, and over 50 angel investors.
- Funds will be used for team expansion, R&D, and launching a new copilot feature.
- Founded in 2023, Phot.AI helps ecommerce businesses automate design tasks such as product listings and ads.
- The platform has over 3 million global sign-ups and is used by more than 25 businesses for workflow automation.
- Phot.AI has participated in the AWS Generative AI Accelerator and the JioGenNext program for scaling AI solutions in ecommerce.

- Funding came from industrial players and financial institutions, including Alibaba Group.
- The company showcased a full-size humanoid robot in December 2024 capable of basic movements, with a 360° rotating hip joint for flexibility.
- LimX Dynamics is focused on developing both bipedal and quadruped robotic systems.

title: Tata Electronics partners with Himax, PSMC on display AI chips
summary:
- Tata Electronics signs an MoU with Taiwan's Himax and PSMC for semiconductor development.
- The partnership focuses on display semiconductors for TVs, smartphones, and monitors, as well as AI sensing chips.
- This initiative aims to enhance supply chain resilience and meet domestic and global demands.
- Tata's first semiconductor plant in Dholera is set for September 2024, with design support from PSMC.
- Himax specializes in fabless display semiconductors; PSMC produces over 2.1 million wafers annually in Taiwan.

summary:

- The company processes over $1 billion in transactions, aiming to cater to companies of all sizes.
- Funding includes a $33 million Series A led by Bain Capital Ventures and an $18 million seed round, with notable backers.
- Grain has now raised a total of $33 million in a series A funding round.
- Founded in 2022, Grain focuses on foreign exchange optimization using AI-driven automation in the $150 trillion global commerce sector.

summary:

- India aims to increase EV penetration from 7-8% to 30% and raise non-fossil energy generation from 100GW to 500GW by 2030.

summary:
- The term 'dark woke' emerged post-Trump's reelection, urging liberals to adopt a tougher, more aggressive approach.
- Examples include AOC's provocative comments and new strategies among Democrats like Robert Garcia.
- Critics argue that 'dark woke' often equates to using slurs under the guise of leftist language, reflecting a shift towards meaner politics influenced by Trump's style.

summary:

- The announcement was made during the IESA Vision Summit in Gandhinagar, with a memorandum of understanding (MoU) signed with the Gujarat government.
- The plant is expected to be operational by year-end and will produce components for telecom, AI, and 5G.

summary:
- Gong, an Israeli sales intelligence platform, has surpassed a US$300 million annual revenue run rate.
- The growth is attributed to the adoption of AI-powered solutions, with revenue increasing by 25%-30% annually.
- The company counts four Fortune 10 firms among its customers and has seen a doubling of seven-figure contracts in the past year.
- Gong raised US$250 million in 2021, valuing the company at US$7.2 billion, and has not sought further investments since, ensuring financial stability.

summary:
- SK Telecom partners with Schneider Electric for AI data center solutions in South Korea.

- SK Telecom aims to leverage its AI data center experience alongside Schneider Electric's expertise in power and cooling management systems.

title: Trump’s trade policies threaten Israel’s tech exports
summary:
- US trade policies under Trump raise concerns for Israel’s economy, especially in export sector.
- Proposed tariffs could impact key goods and industries vital to Israel’s economic growth.
- In 2024, Israel exported US$14.2 billion in goods to the US, a 4.5% increase from the previous year.
- Business services topped exports, exceeding US$20 billion in 2021, accounting for 48% of global business services exports.
- Potential US tariffs pose risks, recalling previous metal tariffs from Trump’s first term.
- Concerns focus on critical industries like semiconductors and pharmaceuticals, with US$8.5 billion in annual exports.

sources.title: Trump’s trade policies threaten Israel’s tech exports

title: China pilots M&A loan reforms to boost tech growth
summary:
- China’s financial regulator is launching a pilot program to ease M&A loan rules for tech firms.
- The program increases the loan proportion for M&A transactions to 80% from 60%.
- Maximum loan term extended to 10 years, up from 7 years.
- The pilot will be implemented in 18 cities, including Beijing and Shanghai, to support tech sector growth.

sources.title: China pilots M&A loan reforms to boost tech growth

title: South Korea’s KG Mobility unveils first electric pickup truck
summary:
- KG Mobility has unveiled the Musso EV, South Korea's first electric pickup truck.
- Launch event took place on Mar. 5 at the company's headquarters in Pyeongtaek, attended by executives from BYD.
- The Musso EV features an 80.6-kWh lithium iron phosphate battery with a range of 400 km.
- It has a payload capacity of 500 kg and spacious seating for families.
- Available in two trim options: Black Edge (50.5 million won / US$34,674) and base MX (48 million won / US$33,409), both eligible for government subsidies.

sources.title: South Korea’s KG Mobility unveils first electric pickup truck

title: India to Develop National AI Model and Insights from TechCrunch Sessions: AI
summary:
- TechCrunch Sessions: AI will occur on June 5, 2025, at UC Berkeley's Zellerbach Hall.
- A panel titled *How to Launch a Product Against Entrenched Incumbents* will feature strategies for competing in the AI sector.
- Oliver Cameron, co-founder of Odyssey and former VP at Cruise, is a panelist.
- Venture capitalists allocated $56 billion to the AI sector in 2024, increasing competitive pressure from established companies.
- Tickets are available at Super Early Bird rates, offering savings of up to $325.
- Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi announced the creation of a national large language model (LLM) for AI research on Mar. 5, 2025.
- The Indian government is investing US$57.5 million in AI education and research.
- The initiative aligns with the IndiaAI mission, as discussed by Union Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw in January.
- The acquisition of 18,693 graphics processing units (GPUs) for machine learning has been approved.
- Startups and researchers are invited to develop foundational AI models using Indian datasets.

title: Kakao Bank nominates Yun Ho-young for fifth term as CEO
summary:
- Kakao Bank CEO Yun Ho-young nominated for a fifth term as CEO.
- The nomination was confirmed via a regulatory filing on March 4.
- Shareholders' meeting scheduled for March 26 to approve reappointment.
- Yun has been with Kakao Bank since its launch in 2017 and previously served as vice president of Kakao Corporation.
- If approved, his new two-year term will start after the current term ends on March 28.

sources.title: Kakao Bank nominates Yun Ho-young for fifth term as CEO

title: Malaysian proptech firm LiveIn acquires RedDoorz’s rental brand
summary:
- Malaysia-based proptech firm LiveIn acquires KoolKost, a long-term accommodation brand in Indonesia owned by RedDoorz.
- The acquisition encompasses 27 properties across six cities.
- KoolKost, founded in 2020, caters to long-term travelers, students, and workers with affordable accommodations offering amenities such as Wi-Fi, cleaning services, and drinking water.
- Post-acquisition, KoolKost will function as a sub-brand of LiveIn Indonesia, integrating its properties into LiveIn’s categories: LiveIn Intro, Select, and Signature.
- This acquisition responds to Indonesia's projected urbanization, with 66.6% of the population expected to reside in cities by 2035, driving demand for flexible and affordable housing.

sources.title: Malaysian proptech firm LiveIn acquires RedDoorz’s rental brand

title: Samsung considers US battery plant despite policy changes
summary:
- Samsung SDI Co. is exploring the possibility of building a new battery production facility in the US.
- CEO Joo Sun Choi highlighted the need for caution due to a decline in demand for electric vehicles (EVs) this year compared to last.
- The potential US plant is seen as part of Samsung SDI's long-term growth strategy despite current challenges and changes in US policies.

sources.title: Samsung considers US battery plant despite policy changes

title: TSMC won’t make advanced chips in US next year, minister says
summary:
- TSMC's most advanced chip technologies (2nm and 1.6nm) will not be produced in the US until at least 2026.
- Taiwan’s Economics Minister, Kuo Jyh-huei, confirmed this during a legislative session on March 4.
- Kuo stated that it is impossible for these processes to be introduced at TSMC’s US facilities next year.

sources.title: TSMC won’t make advanced chips in US next year, minister says

title: SoftBank-backed cybersecurity CEO quits in funding battle
summary:
- Eric Gan has resigned as CEO of Cybereason due to boardroom conflicts and financial struggles.
- The cybersecurity startup is dealing with worsening funding issues and internal disputes.
- Gan cited irreconcilable differences with the board, following a lawsuit against investors Liberty Strategic Capital and SoftBank's Vision Fund, who are accused of blocking funding.
- Cybereason's valuation has dropped dramatically from US$5 billion in 2021 to between US$300 million and US$400 million as of 2023.
- Financial troubles, workforce cuts, and IPO delays threaten the company's viability, with a risk of bankruptcy.
- SoftBank provided a US$100 million lifeline in April 2023, but internal disputes continue to impede funding.
- The company plans to merge with Trustwave, but instability poses uncertainty for the deal.
- Gan intends to pursue legal action against the major investors, leaving the company’s future uncertain.

sources.title: SoftBank-backed cybersecurity CEO quits in funding battle

title: Sweden Raises Over $480 Million for Sustainable Data Centers Amid AI Demand
summary:
- EcoDataCenter raised $478 million in funding to develop eco-friendly data centers for AI demand.
- Funding will support new technologies for greener data centers and construction of facilities.
- The company has raised a total of €910 million ($966 million) in equity; no IPO plans currently.
- EDC focuses on sustainable colocation spaces and uses renewable energy in its operations.
- EDC's significant customer base includes major clients like CoreWeave and others in various industries.
- The fundraising reflects the increasing demand for data centers amid a global AI boom.
- Swedish fund manager Areim raised €450 million (US$481 million) for sustainable data center development.
- The funding announcement took place on March 5.
- The initiative aims to reduce the environmental impact of data centers via its subsidiary, EcoDataCenter.
- Areim has not disclosed the identities of the international investors involved.

title: Samsung union approves 5.1% wage increase
summary:

title: Foxconn’s Revenue Grows 25% Amid Plans for AI Server Plant Investment in Mexico
summary:
- Foxconn plans to invest approximately US$900 million in a new AI server manufacturing plant in Jalisco, Mexico.
- The project aims to become the largest assembly plant for servers using Nvidia’s GB200 AI chips.
- Development will occur in two phases, with projected opening by late 2025 or early 2026.
- Foxconn reported a 25% revenue increase for January and February 2025, reaching NT$1.1 trillion (US$33.5 billion).
- This is up from an 11% growth in the same period last year, with first-quarter revenue expected to reach NT$1.6 trillion (US$48.78 billion).
- Growth is driven by strong demand for AI computing infrastructure, particularly for Nvidia’s Blackwell-powered servers.
- Foxconn is expanding to manufacture AI servers in Houston later this year in partnership with Apple.

title: Nvidia stock drops on Nasdaq slump, China risks + Nvidia loses $265b as Trump confirms new tariffs
summary:
- Nvidia’s shares dropped nearly 9% on Mar. 3 following new tariffs on imports from Canada and Mexico, effective Mar. 4.
- The market downturn saw the Dow Jones fall 800 points (1.8%) and the Nasdaq decline over 3%.
- Nvidia’s market value fell by approximately US$265 billion to US$2.79 trillion from a previous US$3 trillion.
- Despite reporting strong earnings with a 78% revenue increase to US$39.33 billion since last year, Nvidia lost 13% of its value since Feb. 26.
- 25% tariffs could affect Nvidia, as its systems are made in the US, Mexico, and other regions.
- CEO Jensen Huang emphasized optimism due to advancements in AI and upcoming Blackwell chips.
- Nvidia is set to produce chips as part of Taiwan Semiconductor’s US$100 billion expansion in the US, a project mentioned by Trump.
- Nvidia's stock has contributed over 30% to the Nasdaq's decline this year.
- The stock fell below its 200-day moving average in January for the first time in over two years.
- Analysts have identified support levels at US$113, US$110, and potentially as low as US$90, with projections targeting US$107 to US$103.
- The stock's forward earnings multiple is now 25, the lowest in over a year.
- Market uncertainty affects major tech stocks; Nasdaq 100 is nearing correction territory.
- Tariffs and AI-related export restrictions, especially related to China, add to the pressure on Nvidia.
- Decreasing momentum and investor caution raise concerns, with some experts suggesting a long-term peak may have been reached.

sources.title: Nvidia loses $265b as Trump confirms new tariffs
Nvidia stock drops on Nasdaq slump, China risks

title: AI dominates Wall Street as firms push monetization, IPOs
summary:
- Mentions of AI in Wall Street earnings calls reached a record high, with 50% of S&P 500 companies discussing AI, compared to 30% earlier in 2024.
- Only 6% of US companies actively use AI, with another 10% planning to adopt it.
- Strongest AI adoption is seen in tech, finance, and professional services, while sectors like transportation and construction are lagging.
- On Mar. 5, CoreWeave filed for an IPO after a 730% revenue increase to $1.9 billion in 2024, despite a loss of $863 million.
- CoreWeave's IPO may catalyze the 2025 IPO market.
- Companies are emphasizing AI monetization; Monday.com’s pay-per-minute AI model boosted its stock by 30%, while Fiverr and Kaltura’s launches saw stock declines.

- Apps like [LM Studio](https://lmstudio.ai/) and [GPT4All](https://www.nomic.ai/gpt4all) enable local LLM model usage, mitigating privacy concerns.

title: 7-Zip 0-day exploited amid Russia’s invasion of Ukraine
summary:

title: Trump Delays Tariffs on Automobile Imports from Canada and Mexico
summary:
- President Trump delays tariffs on automobile imports from Canada and Mexico for one month following requests from General Motors, Ford, and Stellantis.
- The tariffs were initially set at 25% on goods from Canada and Mexico, impacting complex automotive supply chains.
- Car prices are at historic highs, with the tariffs potentially increasing sticker prices by $12,000, threatening demand and leaving dealers with unsold vehicles.
- Trump urged manufacturers to move operations to the U.S., but Ford CEO expressed concerns about the lack of excess capacity at plants.
- Automakers must comply with the USMCA to qualify for the reprieve, and tariffs of 25% could resume after April 2.
- Nearly half of new vehicles sold in the U.S. are U.S.-made, while 17.4% are made in Mexico and 7.4% in Canada.

title: The hunt for the next Twitter: news about alternative social media platforms and Bluesky client development
summary:

- Users can follow the [Phoenix account on Bluesky](https://bsky.app/profile/phoenix.tapbots.com) while awaiting the app's release.

- Elon Musk took over Twitter (now X) over two years ago, prompting platforms like Threads, Mastodon, and Bluesky to emerge as alternatives.
- Threads has grown to 275 million monthly users (as of October 2024), integrating features for ActivityPub to connect with the fediverse.
- Bluesky, using AT Protocol, rose to popularity post-2024 elections, boasting over 14.5 million users, while Mastodon struggles to grow.
- No clear successor to Twitter exists as X still functions as a primary platform for many users.
